vocabulary.definition: showing a lack of responsibility or concern for the consequences of one's actions
vocabulary.example: It's irresponsible to drive without a seatbelt.

vocabulary.definition: a compulsive need for and use of a habit-forming substance characterized by tolerance and by well-defined physiological symptoms upon withdrawal
vocabulary.example: His addiction to social media affects his productivity at work.

vocabulary.definition: able to be filled with air or gas to increase in size
vocabulary.example: The inflatable boat was easy to carry and set up for our river trip.

vocabulary.definition: to die or cause to die from lack of air or inability to breathe
vocabulary.example: The smoke was so thick that it felt like I was going to suffocate.

vocabulary.definition: capable of being physically or emotionally wounded
vocabulary.example: Children are vulnerable to cyberbullying on social media platforms.

vocabulary.definition: persisting for a long time or constantly recurring
vocabulary.example: She suffers from chronic back pain due to her desk job.
